intro: Microstegium parciciliatum, commonly known as the small-leaved wood sorrel, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the spring. Microstegium parciciliatum is native to parts of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded woodland areas. It is a perennial species that thrives in temperate climates.
